column4: i want to search my network for a printer, i don't know the ip of it. is there a way to scan for it?
nmap ?
what line option would i use? doesn't it require an ip?
what is the internal ip of your machine ?
you can do domething like "nmap -sP 192.168.0.0/24"
i don't know the ip of the machine
you know the ip of at least one machine in your local network ?
not off the top of my head
ifconfig
local ip for WLAN adapter is 192.168.0.163
so "sudo nmap -sP -A 192.168.0.0/24" should help you :)
thnx
Oops first find the machine on your network with "nmap -sP 192.168.0.0/24"
then try to determine if it is a printer: "nmap -A some_ip"
why do you want to do this ?
do what? find the printer?
no switch workspace
because im tired of clicking on the icon and i need a keyboard shortcut
maybe not exactly what you want: alt+f w
that doesn't do anything
you where speaking about eclipse right ?
gnome
sorry
no worries
